column4: Is there anyway to update to breezy from hoary without downloading a CD or something?
Ok, i followed the apt-get directions to upgrade to breezy from hoary on thsi page https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BreezyUpgradeNotes but it downloaded all the updates but it didnt install them.
Ok, i followed the apt-get directions to upgrade to breezy from hoary on thsi page https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BreezyUpgradeNotes but it downloaded all the updates but it didnt install them.
How do i see what version of ubuntu i have?
uname -a will give you the kernel version
I mean like how do i tell if its hoary or brezy?
check if the links in /etc/apt/sources.list point to breezy or hoary

No, i just recently tried to update from hoary to breezy. So i just changed them. And i wanna see if it actually worked. But im not sure becuase when i did the update. It downloaded all the packages but it didnt install them.
sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get dist-upgrade : should have upgraded your system.
you can also open synaptic to see if you got any broken packages that hasnot been installed.

unfortunatly, i did the breezy upgrade just a few days ago. Openoffice was broken and the install never finished until i totally removed openoffice from the system. unfortunatley, apt does not keep a log of what it is doing!!!
took me awhile to find that out :-(
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade and take note of the last errors.
Ill be back in like 10 minuts.
Ok. Well. Now its installing for some reason. But before it started installing it gave me all these perl errors :/
And its still giving me lots of perl errors durring the install.
